data.title: Urho3D cause "Out of memory" exception when try load scene with incorrect model
data.body:
Test files http://virealism.com/LostCoast.7z
It is not my scene, from http://www.gamedev.ru/community/urho3d/forum/?id=217746&page=29#m434

Scene Data\scenes\coast.xml

```
  <node id="4">
    <component type="StaticModel" id="5" />
    <component type="RigidBody" id="6" />
    <component type="CollisionShape" id="7">
      <attribute name="Shape Type" value="TriangleMesh" />
      <attribute name="Model" value="Model;Models/coast.mdl" /> // ERROR
    </component>
  </node>
```

It is strange, but original urhosharp demo (from archive) load this scene succeful.

data.title: assimporter generates different bone names, thus animation cannot be properly played
data.body:
Please see the attached zip file.  skin.FBX contains a model with bones. fly.FBX and attacked.FBx are two animations. If using assimporter to generate the mdl and ani files, these two animations cannot be properly played. Some of the bone animations are missing during playing. I tracked the code down to AnimationState.cpp, function SetStartBone(Bone\* startBone). It seems like some animation tracks are renamed to like Bone17_$$AssimpFBX$... and thus cannot find the correponing trackBone. These two animations can be properly played in Unity. 

[anim.zip](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/files/478661/anim.zip)

data.title: Build issue using Clang compiler toolchain with ccache 3.3.1
data.body: The issue has been observed in Android build using Clang compiler and macOS/iOS build using Clang compiler (Xcode or Makefile).

data.title: Web demo for PBR
data.body: I noticed that PBR does not have a web demo available on the website. So i was wondering if there is anything specific preventing it from running on web or if its a sample you just dont feel should have a web version.

data.title: Demos skip frame when keys are pressed (Windows 10)
data.body:
I built Urho3D 1.6 in Visual Studio 2015 with URHO3D_D3D11 and URHO3D_WIN32_CONSOLE on.
Then I ran these demos on my notebook(GPU: HD Graphics 4600 and GTX 860M with Nvidia Optimus on).
Demos ran pretty smoothly when no keys are pressed.But if I pressed any key (no matter what it is), demos skipped frame.After releasing the key, demos ran smoothly again.
Especially in AnimatingScene demo, it completely stopped when any key was pressed and became smooth when the key was released. Other demos has the same problem but less severe.
I tried to switch the high performance graphics card for these demos. But it didn't work. Neither did building Urho3D with default options.

PS:I tried these demos online([https://urho3d.github.io/web-samples.html](url)) and these didn't have the problem.

data.title: Add functions for mipmap manipulation to Image.
data.body: Closes #1573

data.title: Single pane with one scrollbar for node and all components in Editor
data.body:
Sometimes I have a lot of components per node.
E.g. now I have five ones. And in default mode on my 1366x768 it looks like piece of.. something. Very, very small piece of something.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8576192/18596214/be2ff102-7c50-11e6-8ca0-3cdcaf3c82a2.png)

It would be much better to have editor like in Atomic Engine or Unity with collapsing subpanes on the single editor pane.

data.title: Water surface shook when moving the camera on iOS
data.body:
Running the 23_Water on iOS, when moving the camera, the water surface shook. It happened both using the joystick and other part of the touchscreen. It did not happen on OS X. Was it an iOS bug?

Urho3D 1.32
iOS 9.3

data.title: Frame skipping when CPU is overload
data.body:
In 27_Urho2DPhytics, I increased the number of objects and reduced their spacing to increase the CPU usage. The debug profile showed FPS > 30. Xcode and a timer in Urho2DPhysics::HandleUpdate showed the same FPS. However, the FPS of most objects was only 1 visually. They teleported about their size every second. The objects colliding the bottom platform moved (teleport) individually with about few Hz. Was it an expected behavior under CPU stress?

Urho3D 1.32
Debug and release
27_Urho2DPhytics
OS X and iOS
With or without vsync and triple buffer

data.title: Condition that works, but seems bogus
data.body:
File:  Urho3D/Source/Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.cpp
Line: 680

`for (unsigned i = viewports_.Size() - 1; i < viewports_.Size(); --i)`

This loop works properly, e.g. if viewports_.Size() is 3, i will iterate through [2 1 0].
But obviously condition `i < viewports_.Size()` works only because `--0==UINT_MAX`
Was `i>=0`  condition assumed here?

data.title: Make Urho3DPlayer.h/cpp re-usable.
data.body:
I think that (almost) anybody who use Urho as external library needs some kind of player to run Editor.
Let's make Urho3DPlayer re-usable because it is pretty convinient to use it as base class.

PS: It could be even made a part of Urho library..

data.title: UnknownComponent may lead to memory corruption
data.body:
I've found some bad sequence:
1. I added new component and I used it somewhere in code through GetComponents<>.
2. _I didn't registered it._ Just forgot to.
3. I've manually added it to scene. Just because it was easier.
4. Then my code crashed because UnknownComponent was succesfully casted to MyComponent.

This sequence is obviously erroneous, so crash was okay. But what about other possible sequences?

Type hacking under the hood of UnknownComponent looks dangerous because it can lead to corrupted pointers. UC is the only Object that cannot be safely casted without dynamic_cast.
This type hacking also don't allow to easily fix #1515

Is this type hacking needed only for displaying propper names in Editor?
If so, let's think about better solution like GetComponentName/GetDisplayName virtual functions.

data.title: Xcode 8.0 has issues with Civetweb::clock_gettime(....)
data.body:
Building with -DURHO3D_NETWORK=0 will work of course.  I am new to using this framework, so I apologize if I am reporting in the wrong area.  I will add more details as I familiarize myself with the build process.  I am building on the command line, and I also notice that I do not have the
CMAKE_OSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.12, it's still 10.11.  I am using cmake 3.6.2( installed with homebrew ).

"./cmake_${BUILD_TYPE}.sh "../Project/${GFXLIB_DIR}" -DURHO3D_NETWORK=0" is the cli I use to built the out of tree build of Urho3D, the variables are filled in with a bash script.

data.title: Fix memory leak in Dictionary.
data.body:
RefCastObject adds one ref by itself. So extra AddRefScriptObject call cause memory leak when Dictionary.Get is called from script.

I'm not 100% sure in this solution. However, I've smoke-tested Editor and my project - no crashes, no leaks.

Closes #1582

data.title: Normal offset shadow error
data.body:
Way to reproduce:
1) Open editor
2) Create plane without material, enable cas shadow
3) Create point light, enable cast shadow
4) Set normal offset to any nonzero value

```
[Wed Sep 14 22:57:31 2016] ERROR: Failed to compile vertex shader LitSolid(NORMALOFFSET NOUV PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT SHADOW):
0(665) : error C7011: implicit cast from "vec4" to "vec3"
```

data.title: 39_CrowdNavigation: animation sync
Load model from resources NOT in asset folder
data.body:
Hi,

About Urhosharp and Xamarin.Forms, i think it should be possible to load a 3D model (or any other type of resource) from outside the Asset folder, for example from SD Card or from a file stream taken from internet... 
This could be a very useful features for creating application that dont' rely only on pre-packaged resources, but need to use a more dynamic way to visualize 3D objects.

Thanks.

data.title: AnimationController play full-weight animation
MSVC detects a lot of memory leaks in Editor
data.body:
MSVC 2015 Update 3 detects a lot of small memory leaks if I try to run Editor in Urho3D player. Demos are leak-free both executables and scripts, even script integration demos. Most leaks are located in Str.cpp(431).

Have you tested Urho for memory leaks? Are these leaks real or just side effect of some static variables?

data.title: Fix LookAt Mixed rotation mode.
data.body:
Mixed mode needs true look-at vector instead of XZ projection.

Recent refectoring changed this: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/commit/d19d8d3dbfd962cce273bf43dadaa32bb08bcab8

PS: Yes, I _do_ like const-s and I will write'em wherever possible. Because they avoid errors like this one.
